name: Oak Hill Hiking Trails
reviews: Great trail system with distance and different viewpoints. Lots of area to explore and not a hard walk which makes it easy to go the distance. There are a lot of cutoffs, some circles, and even a few places to sit down. The fire tower is nice and tall which allows for great panoramic views/photos. During the warmer months it would be a great biking trail.

The last time I was here was when I was working on my fire tower quest in 2016. There have been a lot of improvements made since then. Especially with updated signage. If you do all the loops off of Tower Trail, you can get a pretty good workout and enjoy nature at the same time. The fire tower itself is in Loudon, and I didn't go to the fire tower this time. That wasn't my goal. I was just exploring the other trails.

Nice hike this morning at Oak Hill! 
The fire tower is currently under construction so you can't go up to check out the views at this time. There's a lot of black flies at the top where the tower is. 
I recommend a natural non toxic bug spray made with essential oils and always check for ticks. 
Happy Hiking!
Great little hike right in Concord, take advantage of what's around you
Nice place to walk the dog and get lost in the woods. The trails are Marked really well. Only 0.75 mi to the Scenic views w/benches!

name: McAuliffe-Shepard Discovery Center
reviews:
We were pleasantly surprised! A good selection of exhibits and hands on activities. Very informational and educational. We enjoyed the planetarium and the movie on the northern lights. We spent about 2.5 hours at the museum. My son is twelve and didn’t complain once about being bored. There is a small cafeteria and gift shop. 
We had free passes from our local library, but paid $5.00 each for the planetarium show. It was a great experience.

I had a great time here. It was not expensive, the exhibits were really cool, and the planetarium was great to! Spent a out 3 hours here which was plenty of time to see everything including the Planetarium.
Brought my son and older daughter and they both had a blast.  My son doesn't really do well with crowds and the museum wasn't really crowded the day we went.

So cool for all family members! 
A lot of things to learn, to explore, to do, is free, parking lot available, cleaning spaces, bathrooms, cafe, souvenir store, for sure is a place to bring your kids and teach them about NASA and Concord  NH History.

I went here just to look for a squished penny machine. And I ended up staying and I liked it so much that I got a membership. I like that it has a lot of hands-on things for kids to do, even though I don't have any kids. It's good to keep kids busy in a place like a museum. And it's the kind of museum that's not like a regular museum, because you can touch things. They also have a planetarium. I will say the planetarium program is very old, and they do tell you that in the beginning. So it has some glitches, but still it was awesome to just stare at the stars for a while. The best part of the presentation I saw, which was the night sky presentation, was when they flew you to the Pleiades, because it felt like being in a starship. Besides all the history that they have regarding our space history, starting with the space race with Russia, it is named after Christa McAuliffe and Alan Shepard because they both came from New Hampshire. There is an observatory but they only open it the first Friday of the month, and only if the sky is clear. It is advisable to call ahead if you're going for one of these Friday night observatory events. I had lunch in the small restaurant that they have there, and I had chicken quesadillas that were absolutely amazing. All of the staff that I interacted with while I was there were very friendly, helpful and courteous, and that's important to me.

name: NH Audubon
address: 84 Silk Farm Rd, Concord, NH 03301, USA
reviews: Great venue to experience the NH out of doors at. Nice walking trails and beautiful scenery. Plenty of events scheduled throughout the year. Closed on Sundays but the trails are always open. The trails have markers and easy to follow. Plenty of rest and informational stops. HUGE &TALL trees everywhere. Watch for woodpeckers and deer. All kings of flora & fauna to see.

Always enjoy coming here. Several trails of varying lengths and degrees of difficulty. Orchard trail is ea the yellow tail should probably besy, 20 to 30 mins out and back or you can join up with the yellow tail and loop. Great for bird watching and you end up at the pond. Yellow trail is harder and loops onto the other trails. Pictures are from blue trail. Blue can be done with kids over 3(if they like to home) but yellow should be 6 or over. A few wet spots and some rocky spots.

What a great place to bring children to learn about NH'S wildlife, especially birds. We enjoyed a wonderful talk on Arctic foxes, my granddaughter's favorite animal. She was thrilled to see one in person and learn about them and their cousins, the gray and red fox. We enjoyed the reptile room (which also had a lot of taxidermy)and also went up to the Aerie to enjoy the view. Their gift shop is wonderful and had a good assortment of small items that made a great souvenir. We'll be back in warmer weather to enjoy the trails!

What an awesome place and organization.  The people there are friendly and very knowledgeable about birds and other wildlife.  Especially enjoyed watching the owls and eagle eat.  First time I ever heard an eagle make a sound.  The barred owls were rather vocal, too.

Tbe NH Audobon McLane Center is great. The kids love it every time we go. This time there was a kids summer camp in session. It looked fun.
The birds and turtles were very active, hamming it up.
The trails are really well maintained. We walked 2 of them. The kids jumped and played on all the rocks and logs they could find. The bugs were relentless, so bring some bug spray. The trails go along the marsh and pond.

name: Winant Park
reviews: I needed a little more movement after a day of skiing in NH and this little gem of a 3.2 mile hike from Winant Park to Marjory Swope Park and back was the perfect apres ski activity. It was a little mushy (I wore the absolutely wrong footwear🙄), but the setting sun,and brown leaf carpet was a tannic and still wonderland.
May be better in the spring and summer but not too many sights or anything to write home about. Decent enough for a winter hike with the dogs though.

I didn't actually hike the trails at Winant park today. I discovered a trail that went to Swope Park and it was 1.6 miles each way. So I hiked that because I was curious. It was very well maintained! Unless somebody is completely color blind to red, it would be almost impossible to get lost on that trail. Also at the junctions they had very good signage. I would rate the trail as moderate for someone with my kind of disabilities. I wouldn't try to take a wheelchair on that trail. But there was handicapped parking at the Winant park parking lot where I started. There's supposedly a handicapped accessible Trail at Winant park, and I'm going to return one day and look for it :-)
Great little hike.  Well maintained trail.  Have hiked here with my dog's for years.  Not to steep and usually very quiet.
A great hike and the trails are well marked, has beautiful scenery with many educational posts about the park and surrounding areas, ice cleats are recommended, dog friendly park,

name: Chuckster's
reviews: What a great time for a senior coup. Made us feel like kids again.
The park was wonderful. It was hot that day and I got sick from the heat. They need a place where people can cool off.
Had a great time at mini golf and playing all the other activities
Fun fun,  more things seemed to be added a great place to take the family!
So much fun! What a great date day!

name: Greater Concord Chamber of Commerce
address: 49 S Main St Suite 104, Concord, NH 03301, USA
reviews: This location has a nicer decor with the stone-look tiles but the staffs is not accommodating.
The entire staff are extremely helpful but the location was too far to travel.

If you need help getting around Concord this is the place to go guys also a great place next door to help artists out New Hampshire that has absolutely great gifts that are one of a kind New Hampshire Craftsmen League
Join the chamber! Great place to network with other business people. They have events several times a month. Check out there website for dates and times.

The Concord NH Chamber of Commerce is an outstanding organization. The Chamber really gets that networking and relationship building is an important role for the Chamber and its members. They offer great networking events, both large and small. The staff goes out of its way to encourage connections and avoid a membership of isolated cliques. With members from across the state, if you want to join a Chamber to get involved and be involved, this is the one. It has been great for me and my business.

name: The Pierce Manse
address: 14 Horseshoe Pond Ln, Concord, NH 03301, USA
reviews: It's closed for the season now. The surrounding environment is nice.

The Franklin Pierce Manse is the historically significant home of the 14th President of the United States, Franklin Pierce.  Set on a side street in Concord, NH, it is easily accessible.  The staff is knowledgeable and enthusiastic about their mission of keeping alive the memory of Franklin Pierce and his family.  My guide was extraordinary at painting the former president and his family as fully dimensional people.  The successes of the Pierce administration were highlighted, such as the Gadsden Purchase and improved relations with Great Britain and Canada.  Less was said of the Kansas-Nebraska Act and its aftermath.  Pierce's strict interpretation of the Constitution and his firmly held beliefs in States Rights during his presidency began the inexorable march of the nation toward the Civil War.  It is a credit to the staff and guides that after a tour of the Manse one has the impetus to delve further into the life and presidency of Franklin Pierce.

The house is only open a few months a year but brigade will open the house for you if you contact them in advance.  The ladies were extremely nice and very knowledgeable. Mrs. Cat gave our family a wonderful tour and we learned so much.  Thank you for letting us visit!
Went on a field trip with a local school. Very educational and neat
Wonderful historical tour of beautiful home! Also enjoyed their ice cream social and U.S. ARMY BAND concert 🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸

name: White Park
reviews: Nice park to walk around. There are benches, picnic tables and a pond with ducks. It is relatively quiet, but for the playground area.
Checked it out for ice skating...woohoo it's ready and waiting. I don't think skate rentals are open yet though.
I love this park!! The pond and ducks the kids can feed. They have a big play area for kids. There is also a pool in Sumer time!! Amazing park!!
Plenty of parking.  Plowed walkways.  Great place walk the dog year round.

I love this place! It has a lively pond with ducks.  Parents and kids feed them. A great jungle gym, slide and swings for the kids. I don't have children, but there are benches and picnic tables scattered about. There are trails and and it's just a really easy, nice walk.

name: Lehtinen Park
reviews: The "park" is a widened shoulder turned parking area with a stone monument that opens to a narrow trail that seems to connect to a whole network of trails around the river. This seems promising, but when I visited the place I was equipped for a kayak on the river, not a hike, so I could not explore much. There is no boat launch or anything like it here.
Good hiking spot.
Little known secret. Great if you can find it. Lots of trails and tracks to take a dog or a bike. I almost feel bad rating it because I'm exposing one of my childhood favorite secret respites! Enjoy!
Great place to push off on the river!
I love how Concord has set up these little green zones all over the city.

name: Scenic RailRiders
address: 188 Sewalls Falls Rd, Concord, NH 03301, USA
reviews: It was our first time doing something like this,  loved the fact that it's a family business and both parents and kids worked together.  Definitely will be doing it again preferably in the fall. My husband and I enjoyed it very much so. The scenery was gorgeous also. It's a fun activity for the entire family , age doesn't matter either.  I highly recommend this if you haven't tried anything like this. GO! 🙃

I brought my three kids ages 13-6 today! They loved it! The carts are easy to pedal! My 6 year old pedaled the whole time! The seats moved forward! I really enjoyed how relaxing it was. They have small baskets on each cart to hold waters. You are hands free, therefore you can take pictures the whole time! There are 3 stops during the 2 hour ride. You get to stretch your legs while they turn your cart around. This is a family owned business! The owners make the experience wonderful! They have put a lot of work into this amazing ride! We will be back! Great job!!

Scenic Railriders is a great experience for anyone that has a fascination with Railroads and or Nature in general. It's extremely easy to pedal these Railcars which is unexpected and they are very well built and made almost entirely out of Aluminum. You get to see some scenic views of the river, go over a train trestle and pass a farm that has a lot of cows. The only advice I'd like to provide to the owners is to provide a little more information on the railroad and the history of the passage, and maybe a little bit more about his business. Otherwise it was a great experience and I would do it again with my son soon. Thank You Scenic Railriders From: #brocksjeeps
So much fun. Very easy-going

It was a lot of fun. I do recommend everyone try this at least once. It felt a but rushed, but that was just from the people behind us. We were taking our time enjoying the scenery and before I knew it the couple behind us was right behind us. The crew working were very friendly and put no pressure what so ever. I can't wait to go back in the middle of fall.

name: Rollins Park
reviews: Great park. A lot of the equipment is for 3+ years old.
Restoration Foursquare Church once a year loves coming to this beautiful park to worship and praise Lord.

Its a wonderful place to experience a picnic, public events, there is a local pool for concord residents. A soccer field also played there is baseball, softball, lacrosse. An awesome place to walk the dogs of all sizes!
Best park in Concord. Sun, shade, places to sit.  Walk the dog or fun with kids. Trails plowed in Winter.  Awesome!
We love Rollins Park, in all four seasons. Always beautiful. Always fun. Wonderful place to make memories with friends, and family.

name: Mary Baker Eddy Historic House
address: 62 N State St, Concord, NH 03301, USA
reviews: I LOVE HOW IT TAKES ME BACK FROM TIMES TO TIMES LIKE THE PAST TO PRESENT LIKE ALWAYS CURRENT AND NEW!!!
Very nice place  but the guide was not really good.
Nice place- the guide was very nice n knowledgeable.

This is a great little piece of history. Two rooms are furnished in period pieces similar to what Mary Baker Eddy would have. Another room is dedicated to Pleasant View, her next home that she loved but is no longer standing. Another room has a video about her life and pictures. One thing I learned from the tour is how dedicated to her community she was.
Wonderful step back in time. Great learning experience for the adults as well as kids

name: Hannah Duston Memorial State Historic Site
reviews: Never been here but want to. I am a direct descendant of her on my Grandma Websters side. I will one day get out there to see the "mother of the American tradition of scalp-hunting." Not that I condone that now days, but 300 plus years ago it was a way of survival.
Great historic spot.

She is my 9th Great Aunt .. A True Blooded Emerson! My favorite place to visit and think how it was in 1697 being capture and dragged from Harverhill Mass to where her statue stands. What bravery she showed and made it home to her family after they thought she was dead! 1st woman erected statue in the United States to honor her
Nice trail walk today down by the river
The area needs a lot of upkeep.. Not a place to bring small children

name: Canterbury Shaker Village
reviews: Oh my goodness I loved this place. It is a must see! So much history. It is so well taken care of and I learned so much. I honestly did not know anything about Shakers before this. They were truly hard working people. I love how they got their name!

The Canterbury by Candlelight Christmas tour was just magical! It was blowing a gale, but nobody cared...we just bundled up and enjoyed the ambiance. Our guide Bill was a hoot and a half! 
An amazing and heartwarming connection to the past, at a time when a simpler, quieter lifestyle has more and more appeal!

Like stepping back in time
 Learn about a simpler life but it was also a time of great learning skills that are falling by the wayside to modrrn tech. These skills taught pride in what you did and created. Now there is no pride because machines can't take pride as they don't feel.

The late 18th century in New England as it was when the Shakers established Canterbury brings to the eye a most beautiful study of architectural lines.  Each building had a purpose and a design to maximize efficiency. The beauty astounds me on each visit.   This village is protected as as national historic monument.   A must-see in New Hampshire.
Very interesting place from a historical perspective. Loved the fact that women and men were regarded as equals in many aspects of their work and lives.

name: Mercury Redstone Rocket
reviews: Great piece of cold war history in the middle of a small town!
I didn't get to go inside the museum but even admiring the rocket outside was worth it.
Great photo opportunity. It is also quite amazing.
Who is Wernher von Braun?

name: North East Motor Sports Museum
reviews: Such an interesting spot!!  Decided to do the membership since it wasn't the much more than 2 admissions!
Absolutely love the displays and History.  Dick Bergerren is a wonderful historian of the sport and very eager to share stories and knowledge
Very impressed. They've done a great job memorializing racing in New England.
ARCA champion Austin Theriault's car and Eddie MacDonald's car are inly 2 of the historical cars there. Everyone should visit!!

Great non-profit museum near NHMS.  Lots of history. Loved the John Buffum display. They have great presentations and car shows. Membership cost is super reasonable. I strongly recommend, if you're a gear head in new england, stop by.

name: Clough State Park
address: 455 Clough Park Rd, Weare, NH 03281, USA
reviews: Beautiful place for a walk paddle or day st the beach.
This place is unbelievable. I go there all summer. Looks like Switzerland. Great beach, there are tables, grills available, 4 dollars per person. So clean! So quiet! love!
The views are wonderful! Nature at it's finest. What a great place to take in the sights and sounds, to get away from the everyday and just let things flow and be.

Great place to spend the day alone, with friends or family around a beautiful lake.  The water temperature was lovely.  People were boating, swimming, fishing and kayaking. Lifeguard on duty.  Picnic tables, barbecue pits and grill stations throughout and available port-a-potties. Sites available for larger groups and events.  Great time had by all of us!

Beautiful setting & pretty clean- but often quite crowded. Black flies are a problem out on the water & sand wasps are pretty intense the second half of August.
All in all I like it though.

name: Currier Museum of Art
reviews: I was here for the Shaker Furniture exhibition. The facility is very nice. The collection of works was excellent. I wish that more emphasis had been given to the craftsmanship of the pieces, instead of just their historical provenance. None of the cabinets had drawers pulled out to display their joinery, which was a disappointment. A better historical furniture exhibition can be found at the MFA in Boston.

Remarkably good provincial art gallery.  Nice cafe area.  Knowledgeable docents. Decent shop.  Great art programs for children and adults. We've been supporters for years because of the leadership they show for local arts.

The Currier is always creative and I enjoy it each time I go.  Refreshing, thought-provoking, fascinating, joyful, diverse, friendly.  I would use all these to describe my experiences there.  Wonderful exhibits and activities.  Community engagement.  Family friendly.  Plus the winter garden cafe, the gift shop, and the Frank Lloyd Wright house.  Marvelous.

It’s funny I don’t think a lot of people in NH realize that we have our own Art Museum! The Currier is awesome though, they work hard at getting new featured exhibits and keeping their collection fresh!  They also offer arts classes and have a bunch of events throughout the year!

Came here for a tour of the Frank Lloyd Wright designed Zimmerman house. Tour was great with helpful and informative guides. The museum has a nice collection and a moderately priced deli inside. Blue trees looked beautiful but a bit bare as it's winter.

name: Contoocook Railroad Covered Bridge
reviews: The covered bridge and train were awesome. The history was great to hear. Met some really nice people working on the train.
Worth stopping by if you are in the area.

Stumbled upon this covered bridge while driving and had to stop to view this beautiful construction. Situated over the river, the biggest challenge was getting photos of just the bridge as people clamored about.
Gorgeous place to do engagement pics!
Beautiful and photogenic historic bridge there are some nice trails to walk in the area as well.

name: Hatbox Theatre
address: 270 Loudon Road, Suite 1161, Concord, NH 03301, Concord, NH 03301, USA
reviews: I attended the Goblin Market production this past Friday, and was thrilled about the experience. Not only is the theater very accessible, easy parking, has great programming, live music, and an intimate environment, it's also repurposing an otherwise empty space in a mall - brilliant!

This is a different experience. Sort of a cross between a small stage startup and open Mic. I mean this in the best possible way. It is an intimate setting. In that there are a few rows, so everyone is close to the stage. They use lights, screens, and a few props to set the scenes. The acting is very good, as is the timing. Everything moves along smoothly. This is a very casual setting. Maybe to casual. There is a bit of bantering between staff that make it seem as though they are still working at the process. Yet Hatbox has been here for a while. Well worth the price of the show, family friendly, snacks VERY reasonable price, and every seat is a great seat.
Sorry it took me so long to try one of their plays.  Great evening.  We will be back soon and often.  Very reasonable price, so if you don't care for the play little is lost.

What a great little theatre! And such a wide selection of entertainment offered. Come out and enjoy real live theater & Performance Art. I really love Tales Told. Every community needs a place where the folk can  share their tales. Next time you come by the old mall check in.
This is a great space for productions. Mall has free parking which is nice.

name: Old North Cemetery
address: 141 N State St, Concord, NH 03301, USA
reviews: Truly historic in nature, the burial place of 14th President of the United States, Franklin Pierce.  The Pierce plot is located in the Minot enclosure, a small fenced in area off the main area of the cemetery.  Pierce's strict interpretation of the Constitution and his firmly held beliefs in States Rights during his presidency began the inexorable march of the nation toward the Civil War.
Support your history and get your kids involved! Make it a game.

a gem in the city for folks who like to visit old graveyards. In the summer, there are  is a group of middle school students who give free, and informative tours, as well. a great way to spend 30-45 minutes.
Have always enjoyed visiting this super  awesome graveyard whenever I was visiting my aunt.

name: The Escape Room Experience
reviews: Christmas at this grandma's was greatly enhanced by the fun our 3 generations of family enjoyed at the Escape Room Experience "Christmas at Grandma's" themed room!  It was rated as Easy but was challenging enough to engage two 13 year old boys for their first escape room experience as well as the 4 adults with limited experience.  We will definitely plan to bring the grandsons for another escape when they visit this summer!
It was really great! I was surprised at how much fun and it was more difficult then we had expected! I would definitely do another room...excited to hear the slasher room is coming this Spring!

This is our second time visiting The Escape Room Experience as a team building activity. It is amazing to see how everyone can play a part in solving the puzzles! We were happy to complete The Fortune Teller and leave with our souls! We look forward to our next trip.
Great family fun for a 13 year old's birthday party.  These guys run a polished and exciting shop and are clearly excited about providing an awesome experience. Mission accomplished.
This place is great. Super unique puzzles. The dungeon master was fantastic. The story of the hangover room was entertaining.

name: Bear Brook State Park
reviews: This park is beyond amazing and I say this with a lot of reservations as I'd like to keep this treasure a secret. The park is absolutely amazing as I bike it, hike it, ski it and it is always a great time. Luck to have resources like this to get out and enjoy nature.

This state park is beautiful. The staff is very knowledgeable and assisted us quickly and efficiently. They offer camping for the day, rest rooms and changing rooms. You won't be disappointed stopping at this state park!
Beautiful state park, with nice trails for walking. Did our first day hike on new years day here and really enjoyed it!
It was beautiful there. Bathrooms are to way you would expect a park to be. So not great but that is why the price is cheap. I would love for them to add more electrical site work ups for RVs.
Nicely marked trails. Beautiful hike with the dogs. Nice foliage in the fall.

name: Escape Hour House
reviews: Had a great night in the "Russian connection" room. Will definitely be back to try another room. Recommend to anyone. Was great!
Very fun!  Well thought out escape room.
Best escape room I’ve done! Really well set up and lots of fun to solve. Highly recommend.
This was such an awesome, fun experience for a surprise bday! Highly recommend! 👍🏻

Group of friends booked Swan Song and The Russian Connection. Had a blast! The rooms were both challenging and took us the whole hour to complete. We all had to work together and everyone loved it. We will definitely be back when Mission Impossible opens!

name: SEE Science Center
reviews: Great place for kids! Not too big, and not as overweight as some of the larger museums. A hidden gem!

Great place for kids. More like 4/5 years or older. Lots of interaction toys ..like how engines work and how pulley systems work. They also have a Giant lego set of the old millyard. This is the main reason we went. Cheap prices.

SEE Science Center has many 'home grown exhibits, see which one your kids like the best as the explore the both floors.  Is there a concept  that needs to be explained, make a suggestion the staff, maybe they can design and build it. 
Do not miss The Millyard Museum on the ground level.

This Science Center is housed in a commercial building shared with other companies. The building itself is very nice. There’s 2 floors of stuff to do and the science demos are very nice. You have to park on the street, but there’s plenty of parking and it is free on weekends. I don’t know if it would be harder to find parking during the weekday though.
Amazing hands on displays for kids to test out

name: Zimmerman House
reviews: Tour of the  Zimmerman house departs from the art museum and it was the highlight of my trip to Manchester. The docent was very knowledgeable about the house and had lots of information to share going from the design stage all the way through to how the house came into the museum's possession and the work that was needed to keep it in great condition for guests to walk through. Seeing a FLW house as it was actually lived in was magical.

The Zimmerman house is a restored Frank Lloyd  Wright creation, built in NH in the early 1950s for a couple who both worked in the medical field. The house apparently cost about $60, 000 all in and is close to 1600 square feet with two bedrooms. The home althoug small by today's standards, is incredibly well placed on the lot and wonderfully quiet. The interior feels a lot like Kentucky Nob in Pennsylvania,. You enter with traditional Frank Lloyd Wright compression, take a right and enter the great room. It has extremely small windows along the front of the house above the banquette of couches running along the front wall facing toward the back of the house. The back side of the great room is filled with windows and planters that allow for an indoor outdoor feeling. Moving around the center axis of the house you come back to the kitchen area that's placed exactly in the same way it is with Kentuck Nob. The central Kitchen and operational center of the house is found within the central access and core of the structure. There is a master bedroom in the back off the kitchen. From the front door if you enter and turn left, you'll go along a corridor that then goes back to an open area that could also be a bedroom with a bath for any guests that might have stayed over. The home is maintained in a Suburban setting still by the preservationist of The Currier Museum of Art in Manchester. Tours start at The Currier Museum and take about 5 minutes by bus to get to the actual property. You'll be asked to don protective booties before you enter the home, and the care and restoration that the museum has put into the home shows. It's beautiful. And if you're a Wright fan, it's a must see and wonderful example nestled in the woods of New Hampshire.

It is a mus for Frank Lloyd Wright admirer. Reservations required for all tours, it is recommended purchasing tickets well in advance, number of people is limited, adult admission $25. Tour starts at the Currier Museum of Art, little bus will take you to the house. 90 minutes tour is guided by volunteer and we were lucky, our volunteer was really knowledgeable and pasionet. She made the whole tour very interesting and added personal stories. Thank you! After the tour you can visit the Currier Museum of Art for free.

Had so much fun in my daughters field trip today with my husband. We really enjoyed coming there. If you can appreciate art and a little bit of history this is the place to go. I have never been to any other art museum so it was my first time but seeing it in person was so much nicer than what people claim online or in books or through TV or movies. I enjoyed the entertainment they provided for the kids and got the kids to make their own artwork. This place was really nice one day i will have to go and really look at everything myself

The only Frank Lloyd Wright house you can tour in New Hampshire (recently, the museum bought the Kalil House nearby, so the museum owns the only two FLW houses in NH). Worth the detour if you are in the Manchester area. FLW's Usonian house is at the origin of all American bungalows. The volunteer guides are very diligent about the house: you reach the house by bus only from the Currier Museum, you cannot touch anything --like in a museum--, you have to wear shoe covers, you cannot take pictures inside. They are a bit fussy, at Fallingwater, we can take pictyures inside.

name: Pats Peak Ski Area
reviews:
My family and I went skiing for the first time here. All of the employees were very nice and the place was very organized. My family and I had a really fun day together skiing and taking the beginner lesson. A few of us (who had skied once before) did some green slopes later.
The chicken tenders, big cookies, and hot chocolate were awesome. During meal times the chicken tenders are disappearing so fast they keep coming out freshly fried. Remember to ask for marshmallows to go with the hot chocolate.
I would happily go back here for another novice day of skiing with family or friends.

One of the best family ski areas. It gets crowded but the staff is good at handling crowds. We had ski classes for the whole family and all the instructors were very good and friendly and eager to help. Tubing area is fun for all ages. It gets crowded too but lines move quickly thanks to staff. The slopes were well maintained. The lodge seemed crowded but we always find a spot to sit. The food in the cafeterias are good, too. Rentals move seamlessly.

Always a fun ski area. Brought my son and we both had a blast. Lift lines were reasonable, as was the space in the lodge. We ate lunch off peak time and there was no problem finding a table, and no line at the cafeteria. Food was surprisingly good for ski area cafeteria food. I've liked Pat's Peak for casual family friendly skiing since I was a kid, and this last visit didn't disappoint.

My daughter and I only went snowtubing. Forty dollars for two hours per person, price I suppose is reasonable since maintaining a place so big, especially since they make their own snow. It hasn't snowed in weeks and there was plenty for winter activities. 
The staff was very accommodating to my daughter because of her needs and let my daughter ride down sitting since she was scared going down head first. I prefer not to go down head first as well since your head could take a possible impact. But, we had fun. Forty degree weather was nice.
Parking lot was tough on the suspension of cars. I saw on car bump the ground because the car drove low to the ground.
Very busy and popular place. I would go again.

This mountain has a very family friendly and "homey vibe". The lodges are beautiful and they are always making improvements around the mountain, to quote a staff member: "There is no finish line." The customer service is on point here. The staff here are so helpful that when I brought my new boots to be refitted to my skis they not only offered to do it for free they found a problem with my boots and gave me a voucher for a completely free set of rental gear. There is no shortage of commendations I have for this mountain and their staff. While it may be on the smaller side, the mountain offers plenty of trails, features, and reliable snow making. I've been going here for years and it has never let me down.

name: The Palace Theatre
reviews: The palace theatre is such a beautiful venue. The seats are fantastic no matter where you sit. The staff are extremely professional and helpful. And the actors are always amazing. We see plays with our kids and they love it every time. We also see plays just the 2 of us and have an amazing time with other adults. My favorite venue for a good play with a fancy feeling

A beautiful theater with amazing acoustics! Ticket prices are very reasonable and a membership is only $75! The staff were wonderful.  The merchandise was cash only so be prepared...there is not an ATM at the venue.

Love the Palace Theater in Manchester we go often and are members. Most shows are 39.00 dollars each for tickets.  Can't beat a nice night out and a good show for under $100.00 for 2 tickets. If you become members you get 2 free tickets each year also.Also some good restaurants near by that the theater gives coupons to members.

One of my favorite places in Manchester! They have great shows and do a lot in the community. Take advantage of all they have to offer, you don't see this much programme anywhere else nearby. I love going to see shows and keeping up with their latest news. The Palace is also a beautiful theater worth a visit any time!
This venue is absolutely amazing! Just the right size to get great views, awesome sounds and great shows! They do an excellent job with the youth!

name: Cowabunga's!
reviews: I went here for the birthday of  a friend's child. I have never been to a place like this so I cannot compare it to any other.  What I do know is that the place was very clean, safe and well staffed. The noise level was insane but that's to be expected with music, children and blowers running to keep things inflated.

My kiddos had a blast. We have been in a lot of bounce house places and this is by far the best.

I had fun in the arcade machines, specially Ms. PacMan. The place must have read the other person’s complain about the carpet. I saw pads around the bounce houses so no worries. $12 per kid was so worth it.
I love this place, my son loves it as well he was 3 in these pictures but he is 6 now and still has a blast on all the slides etx

We went here with our twin granddaughters. They had a blast! There were many things for them to try. They had favorites but as kids grow, they need to try new challenges. Cowabunga's gave them the latitude to gave fun and to stretch their courage a little. They loved it which is all that's necessary!
Half the stuff they didn't open until way later in the day. Kids got bord really quick. It would be a ideal place to bring 2-4 year old

name: Franklin Pierce Homestead State Historic Site
address: 301 2nd New Hampshire Turnpike, Hillsboro, NH 03244, USA
reviews: Beautiful historical home. (I LOVE old architecture.) The tour guide, Sara, was very knowledgeable and extremely friendly. Definitely worth a visit.

Fascinating house and knowledgeable historians/tour guides. The gift shop is a plus. To this day my son regales facts when we pass, which is everyday as we're neighbors. Rarely can a person visit the home of a president. As history is being lost with younger generations, having a tour of this homestead inspires learning, and more importantly history can be learned and touched by children, leaving an impression that lasts.
The volunteers are knowledgeable and friendly. The home is a museum, smaller family members should be able to climb stairs and be patient with standing behind the chords
Lovely historic place filled with interesting books, China and a documentary.  The house and grounds are superbly kept.
I loved  visiting this house.  The tour guide was swift & knowledgeable.  So interesting.  They've done an excellent job of restoration.

name: Memorial Arch of Tilton
reviews: Piece of my childhood. Perfect sledding spot. Great for picnics. Good for prom pictures. random piece of history

Beautiful Place To Hang Out And Sit Around. The Arch Is Massive And Is A Place With Many Mysterious Rumors To Constantly Spark. A Place To Respect And A Place That Will Stand. 

- A Top Notch Place To Visit While Your In Town

The Tilton Arch is a life-sized reproduction of an arc in France, and located atop my childhood sliding hill! As a child, and living below it on Arch Street, I thought my family owned it... Great place to visit in the summer (there are grills to accommodate you), and it's also a curious, interesting landmark.
Beautiful tall Arch in a nicely landscaped park where you can barbeque too.
Beautiful up there. Nice place to take photos!

name: Pawtuckaway State Park
reviews: I love 5 minutes from this park and go almost every weekend. It's a good little park and has some nice short hikes. If you are looking for something more intense head further north.

We really like camping here.   It's unfortunate that it's getting so popular that everything is booked a year out.  Yet, when you actually go, 50% of the sites are just empty.  I'm guessing people from Boston are just booking it up "in case" they decide to go.  Would be better if they went back to taking walkups and not booking the entire place long in advance.  That's why they lose a star.

I love this campground and state park. I originally came here for the first time because I was looking for places to use my new kayaks. I’ve been back every year because of the wide variety of activities. It is such a large park that’s perfect for hiking as well. Fishing is great, sunsets are amazing, lake front campsites are to die for.

Another great place to go camping in NH. We absolutely love coming here when we can get a spot. It's very well maintained, quiet and beautiful. If you have a kayak you will absolutely love kayaking here!
Grew up close to here, able to ride my bike there. Awesome camping sites, extremely affordable. Friendly staff. Highly maintained even though guests can be gross.

name: LOK'd! Room Escape - East Side
address: 750 E Industrial Park Dr b, Manchester, NH 03109, USA
reviews: This was the first time ever doing an escape room. The directions were clear and the employees were nice. Everything was clean and good. Some things didn't work as well like the dollar thing which set us back awhile trying to get it open. It was fun and I'd do it again

Very unprofessional. Called around 4:30pm and was told there was multiple spots available for two different escape rooms. Show up around 6:30pm to find store is closed when it’s listed as 9pm for Friday. I proceeded to call store number three times. First time was a young female that hung up. Second time was a male that said they’re were closed for winter. Third time same male answered phone and pretended to be dominos pizza and when asked to speak to manager I was hung up on.

We’ve done two of their rooms at this location. Our first room, and our first ever escape room, went very well and we had a good time. Our second room here, their hardest, was much more difficult. I think this is to do with some worn equipment - nonetheless we managed to work our way our. I think LOK’d was is a good place to start out doing escape rooms. Their staff was very welcoming and made the scenarios fun.
It was a really fun place to go and was my first ever escape room experience. Check in was super easy and quick. The theme of the room was really fun and different.
We have been here 3 times.  All have been entertaining and challenging.  A storyline to follow.  Lots of fun!  I would highly recommend it.

name: Gunstock Mountain Resort
address: 719 Cherry Valley Rd, Gilford, NH 03249, USA
reviews:
I loved the view of the snowy mountaintops and conifers upon arrival. I tried snowboarding for the first time and found it very fun, especially after I moved from the practice "bunny slope" to the significantly longer slope with the chairlift. 
The staff member from whom we bought our tickets was very friendly and helpful as well as patient with our large group. Since we went night skiing (~ 4:30-7pm), both lessons and equipment rentals were free, so overall it was relatively inexpensive! Unfortunately, the teachers didn't seem very enthusiastic but did their job.

Was there with family over President's weekend. Conditions were very good. Staff was exceptionally helpful. A great value for the money. We all had a great time and look forward to our next visit, soon.

The staff was great! I want sure where to go twice and both times I easily found a staff member that helped. They were very friendly! I had a conversation with two of them. Both said they looked forward to seeing us again. My son was the only one that skied. It was his first time and he loved it! He had beginner lessons and off he went. We will be going back!
Had a great time here on the snow tubing hill and the coaster. It was very warm out and likely one of the last days for the hill. Still enjoyed ourselves for the two hour pass to these two areas.

I absolutely love it here. It is such a family friendly mountain.  We got married here last after a horse drawn sleigh ride. Instructors are amazing for our 5 year old.  Everyone is friendly here.  Summer activities are also amazing.. huge zipline, awesome ropes course. We have tent camped here in the summer and currently park a travel trailer here in the winter. Love this place!

name: Candia Springs Adventure Park
reviews: Great  places , so much fun   small  but  is great.

It is a small water park, but fun for all ages.  I kiddie splash pad, a small pool,  4 water slides and the reef, a pond and beach with a large inflatable obstacle course that ends up 15 out of the water.  Didn't use the zip line or the adventure offerings.  Snack shack with the usual food options, and a cool make your own milkshake machine.
Lot's of fun for the entire family. I can't wait to go go back for more fun and adventure.
Awesome. Absolutely liked it. Clean, well organized. On stage 2 think twice before starting. It is not that simple. It wss our first time but we will be back.
Great family fun💚

name: Manchester Historic Association Millyard Museum
reviews: Much smaller than I anticipated but it was still interesting. They had "special closed hours" that didn't show up anywhere prior to our arrival so we arrived 2 hours before the "special time" opening. There is no parking lot just for the museum and so parking is a big challenge.

Since moving into a Mill building 2yrs ago in Manchester I've always wanted to know more about the history of Manchester. Not the negative stuff everyone says about this historic city. The Museum had a little of everything to see. Our forefathers built a great city and this museum shows you that. Highly recommend

Great place to learn about the history of the Mills and Manchester. 

The layout is logical and covers not only what happened, but why and how it effects the people back then.

We spent almost 2 hours going through the exhibits.

For more than a century, Manchester was dominated by the Amoskeag Manufacturing Company, whose buildings still define the cityscape of today. One of those buildings is the home of this museum, which presents interesting and notable artifacts from the company's manufacturing heyday. It also describes the company's decline and bankruptcy, and the subsequent revitalization of the area, which continues to this day. If you're interested in local history, definitely check this place out.

The museum is one level below ground and was only accessible by elevator during our visit.

One of the best exhibits in NH, tour The Millyard Museum and see Manchester history. At entrance, a penstock greets you, once delivering water to turbines powering the mill. Entering the main hall you see the vibrance water power brought to the Queen City. While your are in the building climb the stairs to check out the Millyard Lego Model at the SEE Science Center.

name: Mt Kearsarge Indian Museum
reviews: Nice place to learn about native Americans! You can walk through on your own or get a guided tour, lots of artifacts and interesting stories. Also the building is located on a arboretum, full of all kinds of trees.

Went here with my son's school on a field trip. Felt very informed as they went into detail about the different histories of the different Indian nations of our country. The nature walk was very nice. Would definitely recommend this place to others.
Awesome place. Plenty of history to learn. Wonderful pieces on display. Highly recommended!

The Staff that showed us around did more than answer our questions. We were shown why American Indians were so successful fisherman, designing clothing from natural resources. As a culture living without our current resources, Mt Kearsarge Staff showed us how Indian choices and ingenuity worked to provide resources for a culture that was not mechanized. It showed me how American Indian culture provided not only for its own people, but designed options for obtaining healthy food, clothing, & transport for those who were willing to listen & share.

I absolutely LOVE this museum! There is so much culture and nature to learn about! The tour guides do a great deal to make sure they answer your questions before you leave and sometimes staff will send a follow up email if you couldnt get answers that day! The events are even more amazing and Bud and Nancy are such inspirational people for making a place like this a home to so many folks!

name: McIntyre Ski Area
reviews: People there are nice, the mentors are the most chill people I ever met. Everything about this place is about helping others which I find nice. You can learn snowboarding with the help and it's nice knowing that you have a community to count on. Great place. Worth going. Even with the three different stages of hills, you still learn a lot.

Super fun afternoon with our group.  The weather was great, the lodge crowded at times, but the food is great!  The tubing trails are fast and fun.  Even my little one was able to do it on his own at 5

Great place to learn how to ski!  They have a great "learn to ski" program and the mountain is small enough to not intimidate the meek.  As a plus, it's downright affordable.  If you're a seasoned skier you won't enjoy the mountain as it is small.  If you're a seasoned skier and are teaching a first time skier, this is the place to go!

The snow tubing is probably the best in the area as they let you "connect the tubes together" so a whole family can go down at once on multiple tubes... Making it way more fun!

Parking is ok and can sometimes get tight like on holiday weekends. They have night time skiing so there's no need to make sure you're there first thing in the morning to get "all your monies worth."

The food at the lodge is surprisingly delicious with average prices.

We went on Sunday Jan 26th. We only used the tubing section. My kids (6&8) had a lot of fun. The downside was the moving sidewalk which brings you to the top of the hill is too hard for some people to understand, you literally just have to stand still. When people don't stand still, they fall down which stop's the sidewalk. That builds the line and upsets everyone.

Small inexpensive ski area that is nice for kids that are learning. Lessons weren't that expensive and were easily booked. Most of the paths were visible from the bottom, which was good for us to allow the kids to ski freely without us. Small lodge, but food was decent and a small bar was open part of the day.

name: David J. Nagel MD
reviews: Had a tremendous experience with Dr Nagel. He was approachable... he listened... and was flexible. We chatted during the procedure, during which time he kept me informed as to how things were proceeding, but found a subject matter to my liking that helped keep me from fretting over what was actually going on. Funny sense of humor. Excellent bedside manner. Highly recommended!

Dr. Nagel was thorough & professional in his examination of my issues as well as explaining his procedure and its purpose for diagnoses. But the real quality of his work is his "Bedside Manner". His engaging and personal manner puts one at ease, and assures that he is interested. I never got the feeling that I was merely another passing patient. I am confident Hippocrates would be proud of him.
I always enjoy visiting with Dr. Nagel.  He is so comfortable to be around and is so efficient at what he does.  Great doctor; great human being.

We're blessed to have Dr. Nagel to help us.  He's willing to spend the time explaining things so you understand.  He is pleasant and helpful.  He keeps you comfortable and engaged while doing the procedure.  His nursing staff is pleasant and helpful as well.  I didn't know that once he's treated you, you can go to him directly if you have further problems.  Nice to know that.

Doctor Nagel did a great job. He carefully explained what he was going to do and the specifics on positioning due to existing hardware. 
He talked through each step during the process to help ensure that I would know what to expect.
He administered the 14 shot that I have received to my lower back and this was the first one that I could feel the medication working on the nerve from injection site to my calf. While a strange feeling I knew he hit the spot.
I will be going back to see him for two more injections in the months ahead and feel very comfortable being in his care.

name: Concord Craft Brewing Company
reviews: Beers are good, nothing blew me away but cool space. I will go back and try other offerings when I’m in the area
Tried this place already with my friend and I am obsessed since then. I enjoyed the fantastic ambience and flavorful dishes and beverages. Kudos.
Cool little brewery in downtown Concord. "Safe Space" is a solid IPA. The DIPA on tap was pretty good too and packs a punch!
Loved the interior setting, small, but brewery like.  Great service, brews were very drinkable

Concord Craft Brewing supplied kegs for our wedding at Lake Shore Village Resort a couple weeks ago. We had stopped in to try it out and the beer was awesome! The staff and owner were super helpful in picking beer,  how many kegs, delivery and pick-up, etc. Everything was awesome about them! Can't wait to visit the brewery again and will definitely pick up their beer when I see it in a store (love the Safe Space IPA!!!)!

name: Winslow State Park
address: 475 Kearsarge Mountain Rd, Wilmot, NH 03287, USA
reviews: The view of the valley from Mt. Kearsage is breathtaking. The hiking trails are novice level but the view is even better from there.
Pretty amazing it's my favorite easy hike in the state by far, with top notch parking.

Great park and access to trails. People here are incredibly friendly and helpful. Park is VERY well maintained, all the way down to the lines on the pavement. Awesome place to bring kids and enjoy the whole day outside. We will definitely be back again soon to do more exploring.
Offers a couple hiking paths up Mt Kearsarge, you can start at a decent elevation which makes the hikes more reasonable.
Great train up to the top. You can drive a fair amount of the way

name: Phenix Hall
address: 38 N Main St, Concord, NH 03301, USA
reviews: Awesome building with some very cool history to it.  I just learned that Abe Lincoln and other notable people in history have spoken in this upstairs venue.  Really hoping to see it become revitalized in the coming years and make downtown Concord even cooler than it is!
Great place

name: Stark Park
reviews: Lovely place to go to just sit and think, stroll, play with my daughter. Friends of Stark park is great love the live music. Also play Pokemon go here too. I've never come across any rude people and it's always clean never any trash or litter.
Very nice and clean. Good for walk.

This park very well maintained , not a children's park as in ...a playground, there is a huge gazedo stage area , you can go on line to see whose playning there. Bring your own chairs!
   Beautiful sprawling area to let the kids run  and have a picnic.
 I was blown away at the size of the Statue of General Stark , absolutely stunning.
The walking venue is short. Its not conducive to take a walk. Other than that its a nice park.
The park is really nice and you can learn some history. But the unpaved trails behind the park is where it's at. You can find some beautiful spots.

name: Twin Bridge Park
address: 485 Daniel Webster Hwy, Merrimack, NH 03054, USA
reviews: Amazing park. Be made me wish I was a little kid. So much thought went into it. Even a place for adults to sit and relax. The trails are gorgeous as well. And we'll keep up with

What a fun place this turned out to be! I was actually trying to go to another park but missed my turn. When I pulled into this parking lot, I noticed there was another park! Well, first I noticed the sign for the park but I only could see a baseball field. But upon further looking, as I walked down the hill, I was pleasantly surprised to see so many people down by the entrance of a trail. This place is so awesome. It's a nice easy park no matter the trail you pick. There are a couple of bridges and areas marked off as private when the trail ends. This is a good place to bring the kids.

Twin bridge is a fantastic spot. There is a great, safe playground for the kids and all the equipment is in good shape and well cared for. There is a small playground to the right as you enter for the little ones and then the main structure for bigger kids. There is also a set of walking trails, so when you're done playing with your kids, you can walk along the brook in nature as well as over the two Bridges that go over the brook.

There is also a little library of books available, sponsored by the Merrimack Public library, so it turns into a nice day of play, exploration and books!

Great place for kids of all ages along with beautiful, easy trails to venture on for all ages whether your a seasoned hiker or just someone looking to take a stroll to enjoy the prestine beauty of nature. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for some family fun or couples looking to spend some quality time just an FYI if you decide to go during the summer time I would highly recommend bringing bug spray other than that... Enjoy and stay safe!

AMAZING. BEST PLAYSCAPE EVER. WISH I HAD IT WHEN I WAS A KID ITS LIKE A CASTLE. I FELT LIKE A KID AGAIN, IT WAS A WONDERLAND. Trails were also beautiful. Never thought I'd enjoy hiking in the winter but the river was gorgeous and made it far more interesting and worth it to go in the cold. Going back next time we're in NH

name: Mount Washington Cruises
reviews: I went on my first cruise on October 26th 2019. It was their Halloween cruise. I was so excited to go on this cruise with my Boyfriend. It was an amazing night for sure. Not only was the food great the entertainment was great and the views amazing even in late October. My then boy friend brought me out to the dance floor after dinner and then and there he git down on one knee and proposed. We are getting married in May ❤ I tell everyone to go on one if their cruises. Absolutely best night ❤

My father and stepmother were visiting us and we thought they would enjoy the fall leaf tour.  They loved it and so did we. Good food,  fun entertainment and amazing views of the mountain covered in fall foliage.  The weather was great and the staff helpful and accommodating.  We'll probably do this trip again.

It was our first cruise on M/S Washington. We booked it ahead to celebrate our friend's birthday. We all had great time! Food was tasty and service was super. The solo guitarist was an awesome performer. Everyone enjoyed the scenery and weather was perfect.

I would highly recommend taking this cruise if you are already there, I would also suggest booking ahead of time. 

We were on the Elvis dinner cruise and had a great time.

There are 2 floors and 2 stages. The main entertainment does go from floor to floor.

The Dinner is a buffet, as buffets go it is not elaborate with 25 options, but it had 3 main course choices, Chicken Marsala, Beef Teriyaki and Salmon. I had a bit of each and can say they were all good.

The cruise is about the entertainment and the atmosphere, we went the first week in Oct and at night it was chilly out on the lake, but still the stars were so bright and close also the moon was out. If you want romance take the dinner cruise.
Fantastic way to tour a great NH lake while having a great time.  Ask about hosting your class reunion, wedding reception or birthday party for that special person.

name: Capitol Center for the Arts
address: 44 S Main St, Concord, NH 03301, USA
reviews: Great venue, wonderful staff of volunteers, comfortable seats, and they even have oversized seats for large people so they don't have to squish into a regular seat and encroach on their neighbors' space. Good view of the stage from almost everywhere. Good selection of snacks that are reasonably priced. This was Recycled Percussion from the top center balcony.
Great venue for music! Volunteers are helpful.The concessions are expensive. Over $2 for a can of Coke. Water as well. Seating in the Lobby would be a nice addition. Bathrooms were very clean.

Good venue, but not my favorite. Getting in and out is tough, bathroom and concession lines typical for a small venue. They do well with what they have. Great atmosphere and great people. I'll still go when they have something I want to see.
Nice place, always clean. Great shows
We've been a few times as part of the Gile series.  They are great!

name: Rowell Covered Bridge
address: 1433 Maple Street (NH Route 127) Hopkinton, NH, Hopkinton, NH 03229, USA
reviews: Small wooden historic covered bridge. Nothing special.
Prettiest bridge around but watch out for black flies in May and June
Nicely maintained wooden covered bridge. Check out the water reserve falls right there too! Very quiet area, nice to just listen to the water.
We were looking for a covered bridge while traveling through New Hampshire.  This is a good one because of it's architecture and it is in use.
I love checking out new covered bridges. I'm from Arizona and visit New England every couple of years.

name: Arms Park
reviews: Its peaceful, you can get close to the water... It's a nice place to just sit and think or read or whatever you want to do and the foliage right now is amazing...

Spacious. Plenty of parking. Picnic tables to eat at. Restrooms close by. Great views. Clear n easy to follow directions. On weekend events there is no parking meter price. Had an absolute blast at Boston Bruins fan fest for the 3rd year in a row.
Located behind the UNH it's a beautiful riverside area to watch the stream and walk alongside the river.
A nice place to see Merrimack river and you can also find chairs and tables where you can seat.

My favorite city park in Manchester! I like its proximitt to the ricer in the middle of downtown. 
I dont't like how small it is and that it does not connect to any kind of longer heritage trail

name: Escape Room Concord NH
reviews: Went here with my colleagues for a fun team activity together. We were all first timers to escape rooms.We ended up experiencing two rooms back to back - library 1 and 2. They were a lot of fun! There was pretty much no downtime while we were there either, we used our entire 2 hours solving the puzzles. The owner / operator was super cool too. Recommend!
It was a challenge. But we had so much fun working together as a team and we escaped!!!

We had an awesome experience at the Concord Escape Room.  I went with my family of 5, cousin and grandparents, and had bought this experience as a gift for them since none have done them before.  It was their first experience at an Escape Room and they were really impressed with the quality of this experience they are not eager to do it again.  Our guide (Leigh) was awesome, friendly, and helpful.  The puzzle was fun and challenging and the place was really professional.  We had a blast and will definitely be back again.  And the photos at the end were a fun surprise and a nice keepsake of our experience.  Highly recommend for everyone!

My co workers and I came to this Escape Room for some team bonding. Most of us had never done an escape room before and weren't sure what to expect but we all had a blast!! We can't wait to go back and try the next room. We were still talking about our experience the next day at work... definitely recommend!!

I went with my husband and two of our friends. We solved the room with four other people who we hadn't met before and ended up getting along super well! It was an awesome way to spend an hour! We did the library room and loved it. Now I really want to try the next room in the series.

name: Children's Museum of New Hampshire
reviews: Highly recommend it! Love the display with the metal pins that you can smash your face into and see your image on the other side! Kids love the kitchen, the submarine and the forest tree you climb to see all the animals. Nursing mothers can enjoy some privacy,up in the young children's area above the first floor. A snack bar area provides lunches and treats. Close to Dover must sees like Harvey's and antique shops.
Great place for preschoolers and elementary aged children to explore. Great hands-on and visual displays/activities. Well thought out layout. Definitely worth a family membership.

The kids had a blast at the Halloween event. They made several crafts, learned about history, and even participated in a 'green screen' video! There is so much to learn and do here and it  really is fun for all ages!
Attended their T-Rex Tea Party recently with my 2 year old niece. They put on a terrific event. We're absolutely going to become members!
This is a neat to places to take the young ones. They have some great restaurants and ice cream shops within walking distance.

name: New Hampshire Telephone Museum
reviews: Interesting and we'll presented history of the telephone. This year's exhibit of the telephone in movies was fun. I also enjoyed talking to the knowledgeable ladies at the front desk. Well worth the drive! I hadn't expected to stay as long as I did, and I would have liked to stay longer to read the many informative signs describing each display.
Makes you appreciate your cell phone going to this museum

Since I like history the telephone museum is an interesting place to see the evolution of the phone, reminisce about phones you had when you were young and see different designs. Great place to teach kids about the fact life want always cell and smart phones. Pair it up with the fireman museum just behind it and the look around down Warner you have a nice morning/afternoon.

Great experience. I strongly recommend it. The staff were so helpful and nice. There is a lot to see so leave at least 2 hours. We didn't get to see everything because we had some time constraints. We used the app that you can download for free and it was quite helpful. Gave a good description on the tour around the museum. The firefighters museum for Warner is downstairs. It's apparently moving soon so if you have a chance, after the museum tour go downstairs and look at the fire engines and equipment. That should only take about 15 minutes. Great for all ages.

I really enjoyed my visit to this small museum. I learned a lot from the essentially personal tour my son and I got when we visited during the week in September. There was a lot of information and facts presented in a fun manner and which explained a lot of trivia, like why some of the first area codes got the number 1 in the middle and others got the number 0. Easy to understand how the old switchboards operated, and you can "ring up" a mallard phone and hear it quack for it's ringtone. Fun! Absolutely recommended.

name: Mt Sunapee State Park
address: 86 Beach Access Rd, Newbury, NH 03255, USA
reviews: This small gem recently hosted my son's college ski race. The lodge is an old-fashioned classic and the upstairs restaurant is a new-fashioned classic. There the pub-style food was amazing and portions were generous, but the best part was the gorgeous view of the hill. Skiing offered enough challenge for all skill sets and cheap tickets are often available for day-of skiing, so don't be afraid of the advertised $60 lift ticket price tag.

Great mountain. The skiers in my family span in age from 8 to 15 (and me) and this is a great first ski experience. We've been going here for a few years now, in a school program, but I would come here even if we weren't. Not a bad drive from civilization and a wide range of skill/terrain is available. The views from the top are simply awesome, spanning all the way from Vermont's Green Mountains in the west to the White Mountains of NH to the northeast.

Nice ski mountain with great views. Not much in the way of challenging terrain but well groomed. A great family ski mountain not far from Boston. Nice for hiking in the summer with activities like disc golf and ziplines for a fee.
Kinda crowded and the lodge was small & stuffy. However, we were told later that there is a newer lodge that has a good vibe. We will check that one out next time. Otherwise a very pretty place.

This place is amazing, stuff in child care was very nice,my daughter had first time on 🎿 and her instructors in two days did great job, prices are very reasonable,food in lodge great plus my favorite Starbucks coffee 👍  person in rental are professional so highly recommended

name: Canobie Lake Park
address: 85 N Policy St, Salem, NH 03079, USA
reviews: Nice little park.  It has some really nice rides.  Not like a Six Flags but Canobie has a much more reasonable price.  We had a great time here.

I had been to Canobie with my mom and uncle when I was 3 years old so my mom and I decided we had to go again since I now live nearby and my oh my was that a lovely experience. Had so much fun looking for things we could remember from back then and enjoyed all the new surprises. Super cute place. Had a blast

We go at least twice a summer. My wife and I love it as much as the kids. Allot of employers offer discounted tickets and employees don't even realize it. We buy passes in bulk in April they my wife's work at half price and they never go unused.
Love it! Best amusement park in all of NH! They have rides for ALL types of people, from swings to vertical drop roller coasters. Just a fun atmosphere! A perfect way to spend the day!

Love this place! It has great coasters and it's very easy to get to! The only downside was it was more expensive that I expected considering it's a pretty small amusement park compared to some other options in New England

name: America's Stonehenge
reviews: We have been wanting to visit for quite some time now and we went on a fairly nice sunny day in early March. When you arrive, you will enter through the gift shop. When you pay for admission, you will then be directed to watch a short presentation of this historical site. (Definitely watch it! It is so informative!!) The price of admission is quite fair and you can either use a paper map and read along with the numbers on the site or you can download the America's Stonehenge app and it will read each site to you and you can proceed at your own pace. It is early in the year and I'm not familiar with how the trails look in the summer, but currently, the leaves are covering most of the site and some of the leaves are a bit wet so be careful when exploring! There are ramps to help people who might not be able to do stairs easily HOWEVER, this is by no means a place that is able to accommodate someone who is wheelchair bound or stroller bound. The sacrificial table was covered and I'm not sure if this is a temporary thing or a permanent thing but it would be cool to see it uncovered. We look forward to visiting again in the summer.
A beautiful place and amazing adventure. We took our 4 year old on February vacation and we can’t wait to go back in the summer. Absolutely gorgeous and everyone was so pleasant and kind.

Thoroughly enjoyed my time here. Ignore the knickknacks in the beginning, they really detract from everything, but just keep pushing past them until you get to the numbered areas.  

Pretty amazing to witness, you might leave with more questions than answers, but that's not a bad thing.
Visited there twice in the Fall two years ago, it was very interesting and the short video of the grounds made it easier to navigate the premises

As a NH native and history enthusiast it was only natural that I visited this place sooner or later. I first heard about it on the history channel: "History's Mysteries: American Stonehenge." This year I finally got around to seeing it myself and I wasn't disappointed. The site was expansive and there was so much to see and read. It's an adventure from start to finish. Everyone there was so friendly from tourists to the staff, it was delightful. This place is a gem and I'm so thankful it has been preserved so beautifully. What a curious world we live in. Seriously, check this place out if you love history.

name: Carter Hill Orchard
address: 73 Carter Hill Rd, Concord, NH 03303, USA
reviews:
One of my favorite spots to get freshly made donuts and a fun place to take the kids apple picking .

There is a play area for the toddlers and little ones and so
much to do .
They sell a variety of produce and baking i teams inside the store.

And dint forget the bird watching area . great spot to look at the raptors!

We had such a GREAT time apple picking!!
This place is awesome. The people are friendly & helpful.
My husband is in electric wheelchair, he had NO problem getting around Carter Hill Orchard. The pathways are hard packed so wheelchairs, strollers & even wagons get around nicely.
They have the best apple cider donuts. Freshly made & warm!!😜
I highly recommend this wonderful place.
It was our second year, we WILL be attending for many years to come🍎❤

Get your complete "Fall" fix here!
- pick apples (they were $1.10 per pound) 
- get decorative pumpkins (small, medium, & large!) 
- pictures on hay bales
- hayrides (I didn't do this, but saw it was a thing :p)
- eat warm, cinnamon, sugared donuts :D
- buy cider, pie, etc. 

Picturesque views of the surrounding valley (they even have a small observation tower/stand to give you a better view of the gorgeous landscape).
Great apple picking and terrific hot cider donuts. Nice views and tractor-pulled wagons. Pumpkins and other treats too.

Great place to go. Great Apples,so many trees. Peaches amazing service and people.  Great views it is completely family friendly and affordable. So much to do,from playground to eating amazing apple cider doughnuts. Homemade pies and more. I recommend. They also have pumpkins!

name: Robert Frost Farm State Historic Site
reviews: You have to pay if you want a tour of the farm house, but to walk the grounds is free. The hike is easy and well marked. Nice place for peace and quiet, and contemplation. Not really a place for small kids unless you want an easy nature walk.

Finally was able to visit this historic site and it was definitely  worth it. It was very hot today so lucky me  I got an almost private tour. There was one other guest. I'm not  big on tours and I'd rather look around on my own but Randee made the tour very enjoyable. She knew her stuff. After the tour was over I enjoyed the grounds  and even ventured into the woods for a little hiking
beautiful place,  had no idea about the trails in back with many signs with his poetry. i did not do the tour, but the guy in the barn was very knowledgeable and nice.

Robert Frost is my favorite poet, so this was a must-see on our recent New England trip. There is a small museum/interpretive center where visitors can learn about his life and read some of his work. The trail around the farm perimeter is worth the half-hour or so walk. There are several stops with his poetry and the stories behind them, and the field, woods, and stream are very picturesque. This was a beautiful spot with autumn color as well.

Even in the off season with the historic home of Robert Frost closed the grounds and trails offer a wonderful visiting experience. It's truly like being in any of his master works written during his Derry years. At various points on the farm, signs are posted with his poems, all located at points that echo the words. My favorite is as the wood trail separates into two "the road less taken" greets you to read and ponder.
The snow was deep and snow shoes made the experience possible. Volunteers worked pruning Frost's Apple trees. A very good way to spend a sunny winter day.

name: LaBelle Winery
reviews: The food at LaBelle is fantastic, and their whole staff is just as wonderful.  I have eaten here a couple of times and have been impressed each time, but this place definitely stood out even more so after my sister's wedding this past weekend.  The attention to detail and courtesy to guests was unmatched.  Olivia, Kristen, and Claire were phenomenal - going far beyond what you would expect from a venue's events staff- I have been to a lot of weddings and have seriously never encountered their level of professionalism and sociability.  Guests have been raving about the wedding ever since, and it was clear that no one wanted to leave at the end of the night. We ended up going back for brunch the next day because the food is so good.  Our waiter, Spencer, was also great.  I seriously think they only hire the cream of the crop here. I would highly recommend this venue to anyone.

I sent my friends to this place with my highest recommendations. I go their often. This recommendation is always successful. The the food there is yummy and the stuff is generous and cooperative. always when we visit this place we enjoy a lovely evening.  I recommend this place with pleasure.

I would love to pick this place up and move the entire thing to my hometown in Wisconsin! Everything was amazing! The food, the wine, our bartender Marie. She was so knowledgeable and friendly. The wines weren’t too sweet like a lot of little wineries in Wisconsin. I need the chicken wing sauce recipe! We are going to stop at they’re other location when we go to Portsmouth. Two thumbs up!

The Bistro at Labelle has become the best restaurant in the region. 2 years ago it was just another place that was all price and not nice. The wine has never failed, but other aspects often did. Slowly but surely in the last couple years it has blossomed. The service is phenomenal, the management engages the guests and is always helping his staff (Ask for Michael, he always makes the trip extra special for you), the atmosphere had completely changed, and it has turned into a top spot for me and my friends. We cannot recommend those lovely restaurant enough.

Hands down my favorite place in New Hampshire! Please do yourself and all of your family and friends a favor and get married here (and feel free to invite me too!) My husband and I got married here on November 2nd and people are STILL talking to us about how awesome it was. Kim was absolutely amazing to work with, as was her entire team on the day of (woo Kristen and Claire!!) Not a single detail was left out and the entire day completely exceeded our expectations. The venue is absolutely beautiful. The vendors they recommend are fabulous and the food is to die for. I am so glad I found this winery and I cannot wait to go back soon.

name: Manchester Poker Room
address: 1279 S Willow St, Manchester, NH 03103, USA
reviews: Great place. The food is excellent,and you don't have to drive to Boston to play roullete and everyone is very friendly.
Amazing friendly staff great atmosphere some very cool locals

When I first walked in I was watching the way the first table on left was played. I believe it was Spanish 21. There were 3 lady's at the table. So I was asking the dealer about the game and 2 of the 3 lady's were the rudest card players I have ever encountered. I was told by the players not to play at this table... I found out later while playing New Hampshire hold em that they were regulars.... dom I'm just like why the heck are regulars treating people like this. According to one of the dealers these lady's do it alot. I have never in my life in any card room I have been in been treated like this..Its a bs small town casino that allows regulars to treat people this way. If I go back and this happens again I will never go back... watch your back here
Great fun tournaments,cash games you can win big or lose big all depends on yourself
Great atmosphere

name: Budweiser Brewery Experience
address: 221 Daniel Webster Hwy, Merrimack, NH 03054, USA
